title: ICD-10 CHANGES EVERYTHING ON OCTOBER 1, 2015
text:
AZ Comp Technologies Reminds Medical Offices to Get Ready
Gilbert, AZ, September 18, 2015–AZ Comp Technologies ( Medisoft dealer Arizona ) reminds its customers and medical offices worldwide that the World Health Organization coding changes known as ICD-10 will go into effect on October 1, 2015. This major update to medical coding will impact everyone in the medical office. Following are the details to be aware of and prepared for on October 1, 2015.
Managers
Policies and Procedures. Not unexpected, there will be new policies and procedures to follow with regard to codes pertaining to diagnoses, disease management, labs, tracking, or PQRI.
Training. Everyone in your office – staff, management, and physicians alike – must be formally trained on the changes.
Software. ICD-10 compliant software must be ordered and installed on every computer in the office.
Billing Personnel
Training. Everyone must be trained on the updated software. The number of codes will be increasing from 17,000 to 140,000!
Mapping and Adding Codes. Since all of the codes are changing, the new codes will have to be pointed or mapped to the old codes. Then the additional 123,000 new codes will have to be added to the system.
Physicians
Training. Physicians will also have to be trained on the code changes.
Documentation. The requirements now expect physicians to tell billers many more details than they have in the past. Examples include: laterality, what stage of healing is the patient in, how many weeks into the pregnancy, episodes of care, etc.
Procedures. The huge expansion in codes is probably going to require medical offices to upgrade to electronic superbills if they haven't already done so.
Forms
Physician bills may not be the only changes to deal with. Health plans and vendors are likely to change their forms as well.
